column5: Sample Question
column6: Example Prospect Answer

column5: “On a scale of 1 to 10, how much is this affecting your day-to-day life right now?”
column6: “Maybe a 2. It crosses my mind occasionally, but it’s not urgent.”

column5: “How often do you find yourself thinking about this or feeling stuck because of it?”
column6: “A few times a week. It’s frustrating when I notice I’m repeating the same mistakes.”

column5: “How painful or disruptive has this been for you emotionally or mentally?”
column6: “It’s exhausting. I cry myself to sleep some nights. It feels like I’ll never get this right.”

column5: “How much is this issue costing you in actual dollars or time per month?”
column6: “It’s not a huge problem — maybe a few hours of inefficiency here and there.”

column5: “Is this starting to affect team performance or client satisfaction?”
column6: “We’ve had a couple of complaints, and the team is definitely feeling stretched.”

column5: “If this doesn’t get resolved soon, what will it mean for your bottom line or team health?”
column6: “We’ve lost two key clients and morale is low. If not fixed, we’ll miss our revenue targets.”

column5: “How urgent is it for you to sell the house in the next 30–60 days?”
column6: “Not urgent at all. We’re in no rush — just exploring.”

column5: “What would happen if the house didn’t sell this season?”
column6: “We’d probably just rent it out for now. It’s not ideal, but not the end of the world.”

column5: “What’s the personal or financial cost of not selling this property soon?”
column6: “I need to sell fast to split assets after the divorce. Each week makes it harder emotionally and financially.”

column5: “What makes you feel like something needs to shift?”
column6: “I’m not really sure. Just thought I’d talk to someone.”

column5: “Have you noticed any repeating patterns in your relationships?”
column6: “Yeah… I guess I attract the same kind of unavailable people.”

column5: “What do you believe is the real reason you’re not attracting the right partner?”
column6: “I have a deep fear of being seen. I sabotage intimacy.”

column5: “What’s the current bottleneck in your system?”
column6: “We don’t really have one — just exploring tools.”

column5: “Have you identified any friction points in your process?”
column6: “Yes — onboarding is slow and hurting efficiency.”

column5: “What’s creating the biggest breakdown in results?”
column6: “Lack of visibility between sales and delivery — it’s affecting retention and profit.”

column5: “What’s holding you back from listing the property now?”
column6: “Not sure. We haven’t thought about it.”

column5: “Are there any challenges with keeping the property longer term?”
column6: “It’s a hassle maintaining two homes. Inconvenient.”

column5: “What do you see as the real downside of holding onto this property?”
column6: “It’s draining our cash flow and wasting time — we’ve outgrown this chapter.”

column5: “What would you like instead?”
column6: “I just want to be happy… I guess.”

column5: “If this changed, what would be different?”
column6: “I’d be in a healthy relationship. That would feel good.”

column5: “Describe your ideal future in this area.”
column6: “I want a long-term, emotionally available relationship.”

column5: “What would success look like?”
column6: “Just smoother… something better than this.”

column5: “What outcome are you hoping for?”
column6: “We want to improve onboarding. Save time.”

column5: “What’s the specific result your team wants?”
column6: “Reduce onboarding from 14 to 5 days; boost retention 20%.”

column5: “What’s your ideal outcome from selling?”
column6: “I don’t know. Just be done with it, maybe.”

column5: “What’s your goal with this property sale?”
column6: “Decent price and a buyer this season.”

column5: “What do you want most out of this sale, and why now?”
column6: “Sell for $1.1M in 45 days to close on next home — avoid bridge loan.”

column5: “How important is this for you to solve this year?”
column6: “Not that important. If it happens, great.”

column5: “Is this something you want to work on soon or just explore?”
column6: “It’s on my radar, but not urgent.”

column5: “Where does this rank in your priorities?”
column6: “Top thing holding me back — I can’t keep delaying it.”

column5: “Where does this initiative fit in your goals?”
column6: “Nice-to-have. Not urgent.”

column5: “Is this on your roadmap?”
column6: “It’s in Q3 planning — not top tier yet.”

column5: “Why solve this now?”
column6: “Budget allocated. Delay affects KPIs. Must deliver in Q1.”

column5: “Do you need to sell soon?”
column6: “No rush — if it sells, great.”

column5: “Would it be ideal to close this season?”
column6: “We’d prefer it before winter, but we’re flexible.”

column5: “What happens if you don’t sell in 30–60 days?”
column6: “Under contract on next home — we risk losing deposit and penalties.”
